title: Physiological density differs from crude density

content.question: Physiological population density differs from crude population density in that physiological density

choices.label: examines only the population of cities, while crude density includes the population of cities and rural areas
is a measure of how density is perceived, while crude density is a measure of specific density
explains density in terms of people per arable square land unit, while crude density explains density in terms of people per total square land unit
explains the density of a single housing unit while crude density explains the density ofÂ  a group of houses
is the number of people per housing unit, while crude density is the number of people per square mile

content.answer: explains density in terms of people per arable square land unit, while crude density explains density in terms of people per total square land unit

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Compare geographic concepts, processes, models, and theories.
